page.title: 01GAZETTEER OF SALTBURN AREA
page.content: Saltburn, Skelton and Marske are small towns in the Borough of Langbaurgh on the North East Coast in Cleveland County. The communities are surrounded by open fields, woods and farmlands but are closely situated to large industrial works on Teeside where many people find employment. Each town has developed from small villages over the last 120 years. Saltburn,the only town that lies wholly within the grid, has a population of over 6000. This semi- rural locality has added attractions including cliffs, beaches and wooded valleys. Within 8 miles are the North Yorks Moors. Residential housing estates have been built to house those working at ICI and British Steel. With the decline in industry in recent years unemployment has risen sharply. Each community has retained its own characteristics and independence.
